Name: Increasing access to data on maternal mortality and morbidity.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing access to data on maternal mortality and morbidity

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
This Introduction was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Health
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to post the annual Maternal Mortality and Morbidity report on its website.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. The opening paragraph of subdivision b of section 17-199.3 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 188 for the year 2018, is amended to read as follows:
      No later than September 30, [2019] 2022, and no later than September 30 annually thereafter, the department shall post on its website, submit to the speaker of the council and publish in a machine-readable format the most recent calendar year data available regarding maternal mortality in the city, to the extent such data is made available to the department. Data submitted shall not jeopardize the confidentiality of the pregnant person or mother and shall include, but not be limited to:
      � 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
